Actually I do not really want to come because I do not really like thick noodles but they provide the thin noodles too. Tastewise, the noodles, the pangsit basah (dumpling) and the baso goreng (fried meat ball) are above the average but I prefer pangsit goreng (fried dumpling) from more famous noodle chains. Their yamien asin (salty) is better than their yamien manis (sweet). I think it is because I do not really like their choice of kecap manis (indonesia sweet soya sauce).

worth the hype! the noodle has good texture, however loaded with a lot of oils underneath the toppings, and i requested to add more veggies on top, baso goreng was pretty crunch & kuah on beside as neutralize all of them! love it love it 9/10 overall!

Good eat, the soup was delicious, clean and has lard in it...the wonton also pork....beef meatball was chewy, perfect for hungry cold nights. The sweet soy sauce they use 'Grape label' was one of the oldest local soy sauce factory locally operating.
Good yamien in Bandung with affordable price. Always ask for more radish in the clear chicken soup. Heart warming food
Tasty food. Friendly staff. An enjoyable experience.
Not Bad
Yummi noodles

I ordered Yamien manis with baso and pangsit and the coco for dessert. The yamien manis is ok .... but if you are in the sweeter side then you must add a little bit more sweet soy sauce, it perfect combination with their hot sauce. Only the protion is not big enough. The baso is ok and the pangsit filled with srimp. Clean place .... have indoor and outdoor tables.
Yummy noodles in singgasana. Many various menus. Not only noodles, they have kwetiaw, dumplings with being cooked special. Must try and come back again. ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘
i like the kwetiau siram, taste good, bakmi also good but the portion not big enough, clean place.

The noodles are thin and firm with sweet/salty sauce. Combined with the crunchy drokdok and boiled radish in the soup, eating a bowl of this noodle will surely entertain your taste buds. A must try food in cibadak/ sudirman street ğŸ‘ (Non-halal)

When you go to Cibadak night street food, one of my two top choices is Mie Tjun Tjun as it has good Yamien (sweet soya sauce noodle) with perfect balance of sweet soya, sweetness and tasty minced meat taste and steaming well-cooked noodle. Go for complete topping with pangsit (wonton), and dorokdok (fried skin cracker). The soup is so good come with tang koei (wintermelon).

Bandungâ€™s Cibadak street food stalls are known for non-halal delicious food. Bakmi Tjun Tjun is no exception. The best Dorokdok (crispy pork skin) in town! You can choose egg and flour based Bakmie, or the rice-based Bihun or Kwetiau for the noodles.
The noodle was tasty and its texture was perfect. The pork skin crackers completed the bowl.
The noodle is missing some thing. I dont know what it is. However kust let my stars do the review.

Very yummy pork noodle, but the highlight for me for the mix offal soup, so good on a rainy day like tonight. I ordered the complete noodle (half portion) and the offal soup. The noodle has a good bite, the toppings were all nice. The soup is good, porky & I suggest you add lots of pepper for better cold day remedy. The offal are all good, clean, fresh, no funny smell. Price point is acceptable, just right. Several payment options available. I paid with Gopay because there was a cashback. Definitely a must visit when in Bandung

Decent price, decent portion, and tastes good. Last time I tried "Mie Special (Ayam, Cincang, Cahsiu)", it tastes good. Services were satisfying. The place was quite big, clean, and comfortable. Recommended place to eat pork noodle with your family or friends.

For noodle lovers, this is a must try place. The noodles taste good, although a bit pricey but worth it. The noodles are non-halal, and have several variety. The only setback is that it is hard to park the car. But for the food, it's good.
Non Halal food. Every time I came to Bandung and need Bakmie for booster my mood I always go to here.

A well-known noodle chain, originated in Palembang. The noodle with its chewy ness straight noodle, topped with pork. We ordered the noodles, Fu kien (Fish cake), Ngohyong. It was great, loved the noodles, not too heavily-flavored but not bland. Something you can look forward to in Bandung
Yummy Noddle lovers definitely have to visit this place. A bit small, but it's clean. The menu is varied, the service is good.

Best noodle shop in Bandung. Whenever I came to Bandung, this is the must stop location to enjoy bakmie/yamien with my family. The taste is very good, the price is affordable, the place is clean, the staff are polite and hardworker and the portion is quite large.

Bakmie karet (chewy noodles) has unique texture. Good taste & reasonable price. The ingredients are fresh. Fried garlic, pickles are provided for free on the table. Pangsit goreng (fried dumplings) is recommended. It provides delivery service also.
Soo good, restaurant owner also very nice. affordable price and very tasty. its always crowded on weekend. also can ask for halal noodles!
Delicious !!! The atmosphere is looks like old restaurant So HOT inside the room. Free Tea , fried onion , pickles The price is standart rate for now.

I tried the vermicelli menu and it tasted amazing.
just trying their Yamien Manis.. Taste good. the shredded chicken's quantity is enough. Halal Food Meatball is a lil bit hard, but tasty broth. Well placed at the sidewalk. 4 stars.

Tempatnya strategis dan bersih. Harganya cukup terjangkau. Rasa makanannya perlu ditingkatkan kembali karena masih agak keasinan menurutku (yamien asin) dan berminyak. Pemiliknya ramah dan mau mendengarkan saran dan masukan.

No matter what you choose from the menu, everything is delicious and freshly prepared. The chicken was especially delicious! Owners speak good English and bubble tea is also available. Highly recommended! Near the big shopping mall
enak, puas, higenis, ramah

2 kali datang kesini di hari Minggu, sekitar jam 9-10 pagi. Kondisi ga terlalu ramai. Buat tempat sendiri oke, tertata rapi sama bersih jg. Letaknya persis di sisi jalan sudirman, jadi gampang dicari. Buat makanan, udah coba 2 menu yg beda. Pertama coba yamien manis pake baso 2, rasa enak & porsi pas. Waktu penyajiannya lumayan cepet. Kedua kali pesen nasgor spesial yg isinya ada telur, sosis sapi bratwurst, potongan ayam sama kerupuk. Rasa oke, engga terlalu asin & manis nya sesuai. Buat minumnya baru coba javanese tea. Kisaran harga menu sekitar 25 rb sampai 50 rb. Overall makan di sini puas. Bakal sering datang lg kesini.
good food good price good time, endog bebek recommended

Homemade pork noodle..one of the best in town. Lot of toping, sweet pork mince, salty chicken. Or spicy pork mince..good food average price from 25k-36k.

A small noodle shop in Jl. Nana Rohana, very close to YDSP Mortuary. For us, in addition to their delicious noodles, the highlight is the "es campur". Unlike the common es campur today, it uses "frambozen" syrup, which brings up our childhood memory ğŸ™‚ğŸ™‚ â€¦
Homemade noodle. Wheat noodle, rice noodle & vermicelli with pork or chicken topping ,extra baso or wonton as requested. Average price and portion. Taste great.

Chinese-style noodle shop in a converted home garage. A must-try for the fried meatball! It's a food hunting game...

Easily found the place with gmaps, not too far from a well-known bed & breakfast in the area. Misua kuah tastes really great; not too soggy yet still chewy, best served hot. Bakso goreng is a mandatory to try! You can always rely on a noodle place that sell bakso goreng. This humble shop lets u unwind in a very serene area, though itâ€™s close at 6pm.

Love their panggang menu. One of the best Babi panggang karo in Bandung. Went here after a long time, and they still serve the same. You can order many other menu such as bihun goreng, kwetiau, ikan mas, saksang and many more. The place is quite hidden because no signage upfront, but the place gets busy at lunch hour. the taste wasn't as good as before
All of the food here is so yummy and affordable. You can get noodle (yamien&lomie), rice with chicken yakiniku or chicken katsu, also nasi tim and dimsum. Worth to try

Hari Minggu yang syahdu, udah lama ga ke bakmie syukur ini Disambut dengan koko yang ramah, harga bakmie rica yg affordable seporsi besar cuma 20rb, bisa pesan setengah juga kokk, dan pangsit rebus 5 buah cuma 10rb ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ sangat disarankan buat yg senang hunting bakmie di Bandung

Probably the best noodle in the city. They've been making noodles for more than 2 decades. Still the best for me. Last I went there the price is around 50 K for a bowl including the soup. You can feel the richness coming from the pork fat. Should one of you is a noodle addict. Definitely try this one.
This noodle eating house serve non halal dishes, old style taste, very nice, price expensive, the place not so clean

The noodle tasted very well with combination of a portion of soup (you may choose either dumpling or pork internal organs). You may choose also salty or sweet tasted of noodle. They also serve cooked Chinese food menus. This noodle house has opened for such a long time. Pricing is quite moderate. Parking is at the roadside. Payment can only be made by cash. You may also order by online food delivery apps

One of traditional Chinese restaurant in Bandung. The atmosphere is so.. traditional. So "indonesian-chinese", ehehehehe.. What I like most? The yamien (noodle) and pangsit (dumplings). Beautiful! They also offered meatballs and offals. The price is quite expensive I think, noodle about 30s K rupiahs (exclude dumplings). Parking lots are limited, especially for cars.
Classic chinese noodle with pork. With a Bangka Island style. My favorite place to eat noodle with babat (cow tripe). This place is a legend ! Nice ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ â€¦

The fall to place for a decent bowl of Bakmi ayam! Go for the mie lebar( wide noodles) and have them cooked extra hard( kurang dari setengah matang) and dont forget to accompany your sumptuous bowl of noodles with a side order of their Yam Pangsit( DO order the 10 piece order not the 5 as you definitely wont have enough of it! Comes with a choice of salty or sweet, both are equally good but the sweet version is unique, best of all, why not order both versions?) Centrally located ( not too far from the main train station of Bandung) and easy to spot on the left side of the street heading towards Istana Plaza, you wont miss it!
First time here but we love the noodles. We enjoyed the fried meatballs, wontons, meatballs to go with the thin noodles. Delicious. Easy to get there as itâ€™s on the way to the toll-road to Jakarta.

Clean and cozy place, delicious noodles, affordable price. Though the place is quite small for groups and a bit noisy cause its located on busy road. I think its home made noodles since it taste quite different from some noodles i've been eating. They accept various payment methods such as ovo and gopay which is a plus.
Small thin noodles, pretty standard, place is clean, service is quick almost faster than western fast food even.

This is one of a good place (clean and cozy restaurant) that serves noodle. The location of this place is strategic (adjacent to Bandung Railway Station and Istana Plaza), but the place is a little bit small, so you must pay attention when you want to go to this place. The noodle is delicious, and I think this is one of best noodle in Bandung. There are no vegetables served in this place, except leeks.

Dissatisfied as I had such a good impression of this restaurant in the past. It used to be a very tasty, delicious, mouth watering experience whenever I visited the restaurant chains. They used to serve salt, salty ketchup, pepper, chilli, in every table to cater to people who like tasty and spicy food. ... Not anymore! ... You just have to follow their taste: Singaporean taste with no salt, no sugar, no spice. ... I would think twice before entering this restaurant again.
